rules.natural: If alcohol was prescribed for patient1, then patient1 is stable.

rules.prover9_expression: (admitted(patient1, facility) -> (assigned(counselor, patient1) -> (monitored(withdrawal, patient1) -> (provided(therapy, patient1) -> requires(treatment, patient1)))))
rules.natural: Provided that patient1 was admitted to the facility, if a counselor was assigned to patient1, then whenever withdrawal was monitored in patient1, it follows that if therapy was provided to patient1, then patient1 requires treatment.
Patient1 completed the program or patient1 left against advice.
Whenever patient1 left against advice, patient1 is stable.
If patient1 was stabilized, then should patient1 complete the program, patient1 is discharged.
Patient1 relapsed or if patient1 responded to treatment, then patient1 was stabilized.
Whenever patient1 maintained sobriety, it is not the case that patient1 relapsed.
Should patient1 attend a session, patient1 was engaged.
Either patient1 attended a session or patient1 missed a session.
If patient1 missed a session, then patient1 is stable.
Whenever a drug was prescribed for patient1, patient1 is stable.
Provided that patient1 participated, patient1 is stable.
Should patient1 be engaged, patient1 was cooperative.
Whenever participation was encouraged for patient1, if patient1 was engaged, then patient1 participated.
If behavior was praised for patient1, then either calm behavior was exhibited by patient1 or a violent episode did not occur with patient1.
Under the condition that behavior was corrected for patient1, either calm behavior was exhibited by patient1 or a violent episode did not occur with patient1.
If progress was documented for patient1, then either behavior was praised for patient1 or behavior was corrected for patient1.
Provided that regression was noted for patient1, either behavior was praised for patient1 or behavior was corrected for patient1.
Whenever the chart was reviewed by doctor1, progress was documented for patient1.
Should the chart be updated by doctor1, regression was noted for patient1.
Under the condition that the case was discussed by the team, either the chart was reviewed by doctor1 or the chart was updated by doctor1.
Either the case was discussed by the team or a specialist was consulted by the team.
Whenever a specialist was consulted by the team, either the chart was reviewed by doctor1 or the chart was updated by doctor1.
If crisis intervention occurred for patient1, then an emergency situation did not occur with patient1.
Provided that conflicting reports were present for patient1, patient1 had a positive outlook.
Should conflicting reports be present for patient1, patient1 had a negative outlook.
Whenever patient1 had a negative outlook, patient1 did not have a positive outlook.
If patient1 requires treatment, then whenever abuse was detected in patient1, either alcohol was prescribed for patient1 or a drug was prescribed for patient1.
Either discharge was approved for patient1 or discharge was denied for patient1.
Should discharge be denied for patient1, patient1 is stable.
If the story was inconsistent from patient1, then patient1 was deceptive.
Under the condition that the story was inconsistent from patient1, patient1 was not truthful.
Either the story was inconsistent from patient1 or if discharge was approved for patient1, then patient1 was discharged.
Whenever patient1 was deceptive, patient1 was truthful.
If readiness was evaluated for patient1, then provided that patient1 was cooperative, patient1 participated.
Whenever the protocol was clear, conflicting reports were not present for patient1.
Under the condition that the procedure was followed by the staff, the protocol was clear.
Either the procedure was followed by the staff or the procedure was deviated from by the staff.
If medication was administered to patient1, then patient1 requires treatment.
Medication was administered to patient1 or therapy was provided to patient1.
Whenever the deviation was justified by the staff, the protocol was clear.
If the incident was reported by the staff, then a report was filed by the staff.
Either the incident was reported by the staff or if the procedure was deviated from by the staff, then the deviation was justified by the staff.
Under the condition that a report was filed by the staff, the incident was overlooked by the staff.
If a violation was identified by the staff, then the incident was not overlooked by the staff.
Either a violation was identified by the staff or a violation was ignored by the staff.
Whenever a violation was ignored by the staff, the incident was not overlooked by the staff.
Provided that the alarm was triggered by patient1, crisis intervention occurred for patient1.
Should the response be activated by the team, the alarm was triggered by patient1.
If the protocol was initiated by the staff, then whenever patient1 is not stable, the response was activated by the team.
Whenever the plan was executed by the staff, the protocol was initiated by the staff.
If the intervention was successful by the staff, then the plan was executed by the staff.
Either the intervention was successful by the staff or the intervention failed by the staff.
Should the outcome be assessed by the staff, if the intervention failed by the staff, then the plan was executed by the staff.
If the issue was resolved by the staff, then the situation did not have confusion.
Either the issue was resolved by the staff or the issue was escalated by the staff.
Under the condition that the issue was escalated by the staff, the situation did not have confusion.
The situation had panic or if patient1 is not stable, then an emergency situation did not occur with patient1.
Either the response was calm by the staff or the response was agitated by the staff.
Should the response be agitated by the staff, the situation did not have panic.
Provided that the effort was coordinated by the staff, if the response was calm by the staff, then the situation was under control.
Either a counselor was assigned to patient1 or a support group was assigned to patient1.
Whenever a support group was assigned to patient1, if withdrawal was monitored in patient1, then provided that therapy was provided to patient1, patient1 requires treatment.
If it is not the case that a routine check was performed on patient1 or if patient1 is not stable, then crisis intervention occurred for patient1, then a false alarm occurred for patient1.
Provided that it is not the case that the response was chaotic by the staff or the effort was coordinated by the staff, then the situation was contained.
If it is not the case that the response was chaotic by the staff or the effort was coordinated by the staff, then the situation was not contained.

Under the condition that it is not the case that it is not the case that a routine check was performed on patient1 or if patient1 is not stable, then crisis intervention occurred for patient1 implies a false alarm did not occur for patient1, then conflicting reports were present for patient1.

Whenever it is not the case that it is not the case that a routine check was performed on patient1 or if patient1 is not stable, then crisis intervention occurred for patient1 implies a false alarm did not occur for patient1, then the situation had confusion.
If readiness was not evaluated for patient1, then readiness was misjudged for patient1.
Should readiness not be evaluated for patient1, then readiness was not misjudged for patient1.
Provided that patient1 is not stable, a violent episode occurred with patient1.
Under the condition that patient1 is not stable, an emergency situation occurred with patient1.

(A53 → A54).natural: Under the condition that a report was filed by the staff, the incident was overlooked by the staff.

(A55 → ¬A54).natural: If a violation was identified by the staff, then the incident was not overlooked by the staff.

(A55 ∨ A56).natural: Either a violation was identified by the staff or a violation was ignored by the staff.

(A56 → ¬A54).natural: Whenever a violation was ignored by the staff, the incident was not overlooked by the staff.

(A57 → A34).natural: Provided that the alarm was triggered by patient1, crisis intervention occurred for patient1.

(A58 → A57).natural: Should the response be activated by the team, the alarm was triggered by patient1.

(A6 → A4).natural: Under the condition that therapy was provided to patient1, patient1 requires treatment.

(A60 → A59).natural: Whenever the plan was executed by the staff, the protocol was initiated by the staff.

(A61 → A60).natural: If the intervention was successful by the staff, then the plan was executed by the staff.

(A61 ∨ A62).natural: Either the intervention was successful by the staff or the intervention failed by the staff.

(A62 → A60).natural: Provided that the intervention failed by the staff, the plan was executed by the staff.

(A63 → (A62 → A60)).natural: Should the outcome be assessed by the staff, if the intervention failed by the staff, then the plan was executed by the staff.

(A65 → ¬A64).natural: If the issue was resolved by the staff, then the situation did not have confusion.

(A65 ∨ A66).natural: Either the issue was resolved by the staff or the issue was escalated by the staff.

(A66 → ¬A64).natural: Under the condition that the issue was escalated by the staff, the situation did not have confusion.

(A67 ∨ (¬G → ¬A33)).natural: The situation had panic or if patient1 is not stable, then an emergency situation did not occur with patient1.

(A68 ∨ ¬A67).natural: The situation was under control or the situation did not have panic.

(A69 → A68).natural: Whenever the response was calm by the staff, the situation was under control.

(A69 ∨ A70).natural: Either the response was calm by the staff or the response was agitated by the staff.

(A7 → (A6 → A4)).natural: If withdrawal was monitored in patient1, then provided that therapy was provided to patient1, patient1 requires treatment.

(A72 ∨ A71).natural: Either the response was chaotic by the staff or the effort was coordinated by the staff.

(A8 → (A7 → (A6 → A4))).natural: Under the condition that a counselor was assigned to patient1, if withdrawal was monitored in patient1, then should therapy be provided to patient1, patient1 requires treatment.

(A9 → (A7 → (A6 → A4))).natural: Whenever a support group was assigned to patient1, if withdrawal was monitored in patient1, then provided that therapy was provided to patient1, patient1 requires treatment.

(¬(A35 ∨ (¬G → A34)) → A36).natural: If it is not the case that a routine check was performed on patient1 or if patient1 is not stable, then crisis intervention occurred for patient1, then a false alarm occurred for patient1.

(¬(A35 ∨ (¬G → A34)) → ¬A36).natural: Should it not be the case that a routine check was performed on patient1 or if patient1 is not stable, then crisis intervention occurred for patient1, then a false alarm did not occur for patient1.

(¬(A72 ∨ A71) → ¬A73).natural: If it is not the case that the response was chaotic by the staff or the effort was coordinated by the staff, then the situation was not contained.

(¬(¬(A35 ∨ (¬G → A34)) → ¬A36) → A37).natural: Under the condition that it is not the case that it is not the case that a routine check was performed on patient1 or if patient1 is not stable, then crisis intervention occurred for patient1 implies a false alarm did not occur for patient1, then conflicting reports were present for patient1.

(¬(¬(A35 ∨ (¬G → A34)) → ¬A36) → A64).natural: Whenever it is not the case that it is not the case that a routine check was performed on patient1 or if patient1 is not stable, then crisis intervention occurred for patient1 implies a false alarm did not occur for patient1, then the situation had confusion.
